錢.definition: coin; money; CL:筆|笔[bi3]; unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

錢不是萬能的，沒錢是萬萬不能的.pinyin: qián bú shì wàn néng de ， méi qián shì wàn wàn bù néng de
錢不是萬能的，沒錢是萬萬不能的.definition: money isn't everything, but without money you can do nothing (idiom)

錢串兒.definition: erhua variant of 錢串|钱串[qian2 chuan4]

錢串子.definition: string of copper coins (in ancient China); (fig.) an overly money-oriented person; (zoology) centipede

錢其琛.definition: Qian Qichen (1928-2017), former Chinese vice premier

錢可通神.definition: with money, you can do anything (idiom); money talks

錢塘.definition: Qiantang River that loops around Hangzhou 杭州[Hang2 zhou1] in Zhejiang Province 浙江省[Zhe4 jiang1 Sheng3]

錢塘江.definition: Qiantang River that loops around Hangzhou 杭州[Hang2 zhou1] in Zhejiang Province 浙江省[Zhe4 jiang1 Sheng3]

錢多事少離家近.pinyin: qián duō shì shǎo lí jiā jìn
錢多事少離家近.definition: lots of money, less work, and close to home; ideal job

錢學森.definition: Qian Xuesen (1911-2009), Chinese scientist and aeronautical engineer

錢永健.definition: Roger Yonchien Tsien (1952-), US Chinese chemist and 2008 Nobel laureate

錢皮.definition: Carlo Azeglio Ciampi (1920-2016), president of Italy 1999-2006

錢糧.definition: land tax; money and grain (given as tax or tribute)

錢能通神.definition: money is all-powerful; money can move God

錢莊.definition: old-style money shop (a type of private bank that first appeared in the Ming dynasty, flourished in the Qing, and was phased out after 1949); (in recent times) informal financial company, often operating at the edges of what is legal

錢鍾書.definition: Qian Zhongshu (1910-1998), Chinese scholar and writer, author of the 1947 novel Fortress Beseiged 圍城|围城[Wei2cheng2]
